channel.title: Gaming computer Recommendations
channel.description: hey does anyone know a good gaming computer that can handle the 3 games i want Portal 2, Left 4 dead 2 and Rift i have may found one but im not sure

item.title: Gaming computer Recommendations
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Jack Freeman:

Would you say this is good enough?
Corsair CMPSU-650TXV2UK Enthusiast Series TX650 V2 High Performance 650W Power Supply

That’s because everyone says “you can make it better without using much money”. So i believe them. And hell it keeps costing more and more.

yes that corsair is good, but afaik the antec truepower I suggested is considerably cheaper, and should still be plenty sufficient for ur system

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming computer Recommendations
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
russilker:

I have no idea who CiT is or if their power supplies are any good, and since the power supply is one of the most important things in a computer, I’ll recommend the Antec Earthwatts 650 instead. It’s dependable, cheaper than others, and can definitely handle the load of your system and then some.

Would you say this is good enough?
Corsair CMPSU-650TXV2UK Enthusiast Series TX650 V2 High Performance 650W Power Supply

If you want to keep it under $200, GTX560 or HD6870.

item.title: Gaming computer Recommendations
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
Hey guys i revived this thread because i have changed all most every component. Please tell me if somethings aren’t compatible (i am not really good at finding that out). And tell me if there is some things i don’t need to buy.

Proccesor:
Intel Core I5 2500K Quad Core CPU Processor Overclocked to 4.4Ghz - Socket LGA1155.

Motherboard:
Asus P8P67-M PRO REV 3.0 Intel P67 DDR3 Micro ATX SLI & Crossfire Motherboard - Socket LGA1155.

Ram:
Corsair XMS3 8GB DDR3 1600MHz RAM Memory.

CPU cooler:
Arctic Cooling Freezer 13 High Performance CPU Cooler.

PSU:
CiT 750W Power Supply Unit with PSU and Dual 12V Rails - Black Edition.

Case:
Cooler Master HAF 932 Advanced - Full tower - extended ATX - no power supply ( EPS12V/ PS/2 ) - black - USB/FireWire/Audio/E-SATA.

GPU:
KFA2 Nvidia GeForce GTX 550 Ti LTD OC 1GB GDDR5 HDMI White Edition Graphics Card PCI-E.

DVD burner:
LG GH22NS50.AUAA 22x SATA DVDRW Drive - Bare Black.

Hard drive:
Western Digital WD1002FAEX Caviar Black 1 TB 7200 RPM Internal Hard Disk Drive.

Sound card:
ASUS Xonar D1 - Sound card - 24-bit - 192 kHz - 116 dB SNR - 7.1 - PCI - ASUS AV100 - low profile.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming computer Recommendations
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
So, I don’t understand the sound card. It’s a waste of money, really unnecessary. I would drop that and the CPU cooler, I’m guessing you won’t be doing ANYTHING that will require a better cooler than the one that will come with the i5.

I’m running an i5-750 and a Radeon HD5770 and I have no run into a game that I cannot run on medium-high settings. For the titles listed by the OP this would be more than enough.

The rest of what is picked there looks good, but I would seriously consider dropping the cooler and the sound card and spend that money on a better GPU or CPU.

@Medivilae - Yup, I would drop the copy of Windows too, that would be another 100 bucks you could dump into perhaps a second GPU lol

Read full topic
